d3des.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002 * This is D3DES (V5.09) by Richard Outerbridge with the double and
00003 * triple-length support removed for use in VNC.  Also the bytebit[] array
00004 * has been reversed so that the most significant bit in each byte of the
00005 * key is ignored, not the least significant.
00006 *
00007 * These changes are:
00008 *  Copyright (C) 1999 AT&T Laboratories Cambridge.  All Rights Reserved.
00009 *
00010 * This software is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
00011 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
00012 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
00013 */
00014 
00015 /* D3DES (V5.09) -
00016 *
00017 * A portable, public domain, version of the Data Encryption Standard.
00018 *
00019 * Written with Symantec's THINK (Lightspeed) C by Richard Outerbridge.
00020 * Thanks to: Dan Hoey for his excellent Initial and Inverse permutation
00021 * code;  Jim Gillogly & Phil Karn for the DES key schedule code; Dennis
00022 * Ferguson, Eric Young and Dana How for comparing notes; and Ray Lau,
00023 * for humouring me on.
00024 *
00025 * Copyright (c) 1988,1989,1990,1991,1992 by Richard Outerbridge.
00026 * (GEnie : OUTER; CIS : [71755,204]) Graven Imagery, 1992.
00027 */
00028 
00029 #include "d3des.h"
00030 
00031 static void scrunch(unsigned char *, unsigned long *);
00032 static void unscrun(unsigned long *, unsigned char *);
00033 static void desfunc(unsigned long *, unsigned long *);
00034 static void cookey(unsigned long *);
00035 
00036 static unsigned long KnL[32] = { 0L };
00037 
00038 /*
00039 static unsigned long KnR[32] = { 0L };
00040 static unsigned long Kn3[32] = { 0L };
00041 static unsigned char Df_Key[24] = {
00042 0x01,0x23,0x45,0x67,0x89,0xab,0xcd,0xef,
00043 0xfe,0xdc,0xba,0x98,0x76,0x54,0x32,0x10,
00044 0x89,0xab,0xcd,0xef,0x01,0x23,0x45,0x67 };
00045 */
00046 
00047 static unsigned short bytebit[8]        = {
00048         01, 02, 04, 010, 020, 040, 0100, 0200 
00049 };
00050 
00051 static unsigned long bigbyte[24] = {
00052         0x800000L,      0x400000L,      0x200000L,      0x100000L,
00053         0x80000L,       0x40000L,       0x20000L,       0x10000L,
00054         0x8000L,        0x4000L,        0x2000L,        0x1000L,
00055         0x800L,         0x400L,         0x200L,         0x100L,
00056         0x80L,          0x40L,          0x20L,          0x10L,
00057         0x8L,           0x4L,           0x2L,           0x1L    
00058 };
00059 
00060 /* Use the key schedule specified in the Standard (ANSI X3.92-1981). */
00061 
00062 static unsigned char pc1[56] = {
00063         56, 48, 40, 32, 24, 16,  8,      0, 57, 49, 41, 33, 25, 17,
00064         9,  1, 58, 50, 42, 34, 26,      18, 10,  2, 59, 51, 43, 35,
00065         62, 54, 46, 38, 30, 22, 14,      6, 61, 53, 45, 37, 29, 21,
00066         13,  5, 60, 52, 44, 36, 28,     20, 12,  4, 27, 19, 11,  3 
00067 };
00068 
00069 static unsigned char totrot[16] = {
00070         1,2,4,6,8,10,12,14,15,17,19,21,23,25,27,28 
00071 };
00072 
00073 static unsigned char pc2[48] = {
00074         13, 16, 10, 23,  0,  4,  2, 27, 14,  5, 20,  9,
00075         22, 18, 11,  3, 25,  7, 15,  6, 26, 19, 12,  1,
00076         40, 51, 30, 36, 46, 54, 29, 39, 50, 44, 32, 47,
00077         43, 48, 38, 55, 33, 52, 45, 41, 49, 35, 28, 31 
00078 };
00079 
00080 void deskey(unsigned char *key, int edf)        /* Thanks to James Gillogly & Phil Karn! */
00081 {
00082         register int i, j, l, m, n;
00083         unsigned char pc1m[56], pcr[56];
00084         unsigned long kn[32];
00085 
00086         for ( j = 0; j < 56; j++ ) {
00087                 l = pc1[j];
00088                 m = l & 07;
00089                 pc1m[j] = (key[l >> 3] & bytebit[m]) ? 1 : 0;
00090         }
00091         for( i = 0; i < 16; i++ ) {
00092                 if( edf == DE1 ) m = (15 - i) << 1;
00093                 else m = i << 1;
00094                 n = m + 1;
00095                 kn[m] = kn[n] = 0L;
00096                 for( j = 0; j < 28; j++ ) {
00097                         l = j + totrot[i];
00098                         if( l < 28 ) pcr[j] = pc1m[l];
00099                         else pcr[j] = pc1m[l - 28];
00100                 }
00101                 for( j = 28; j < 56; j++ ) {
00102                         l = j + totrot[i];
00103                         if( l < 56 ) pcr[j] = pc1m[l];
00104                         else pcr[j] = pc1m[l - 28];
00105                 }
00106                 for( j = 0; j < 24; j++ ) {
00107                         if( pcr[pc2[j]] ) kn[m] |= bigbyte[j];
00108                         if( pcr[pc2[j+24]] ) kn[n] |= bigbyte[j];
00109                 }
00110         }
00111         cookey(kn);
00112         return;
00113 }
00114 
00115 static void cookey(register unsigned long *raw1)
00116 {
00117         register unsigned long *cook, *raw0;
00118         unsigned long dough[32];
00119         register int i;
00120 
00121         cook = dough;
00122         for( i = 0; i < 16; i++, raw1++ ) {
00123                 raw0 = raw1++;
00124                 *cook    = (*raw0 & 0x00fc0000L) << 6;
00125                 *cook   |= (*raw0 & 0x00000fc0L) << 10;
00126                 *cook   |= (*raw1 & 0x00fc0000L) >> 10;
00127                 *cook++ |= (*raw1 & 0x00000fc0L) >> 6;
00128                 *cook    = (*raw0 & 0x0003f000L) << 12;
00129                 *cook   |= (*raw0 & 0x0000003fL) << 16;
00130                 *cook   |= (*raw1 & 0x0003f000L) >> 4;
00131                 *cook++ |= (*raw1 & 0x0000003fL);
00132         }
00133         usekey(dough);
00134         return;
00135 }
00136 
00137 void cpkey(register unsigned long *into)
00138 {
00139         register unsigned long *from, *endp;
00140 
00141         from = KnL, endp = &KnL[32];
00142         while( from < endp ) *into++ = *from++;
00143         return;
00144 }
00145 
00146 void usekey(register unsigned long *from)
00147 {
00148         register unsigned long *to, *endp;
00149 
00150         to = KnL, endp = &KnL[32];
00151         while( to < endp ) *to++ = *from++;
00152         return;
00153 }
00154 
00155 void des(unsigned char *inblock, unsigned char *outblock)
00156 {
00157         unsigned long work[2];
00158 
00159         scrunch(inblock, work);
00160         desfunc(work, KnL);
00161         unscrun(work, outblock);
00162         return;
00163 }
00164 
00165 static void scrunch(register unsigned char *outof, register unsigned long *into)
00166 {
00167         *into    = (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 24;
00168         *into   |= (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 16;
00169         *into   |= (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 8;
00170         *into++ |= (*outof++ & 0xffL);
00171         *into    = (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 24;
00172         *into   |= (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 16;
00173         *into   |= (*outof++ & 0xffL) << 8;
00174         *into   |= (*outof   & 0xffL);
00175         return;
00176 }
00177 
00178 static void unscrun(register unsigned long *outof, register unsigned char *into)
00179 {
00180         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >> 24) & 0xffL);
00181         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >> 16) & 0xffL);
00182         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >>  8) & 0xffL);
00183         *into++ = (unsigned char)( *outof++      & 0xffL);
00184         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >> 24) & 0xffL);
00185         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >> 16) & 0xffL);
00186         *into++ = (unsigned char)((*outof >>  8) & 0xffL);
00187         *into   = (unsigned char)( *outof        & 0xffL);
00188         return;
00189 }

00342 
00343 static void desfunc(register unsigned long *block, register unsigned long *keys)
00344 {
00345         register unsigned long fval, work, right, leftt;
00346         register int round;
00347 
00348         leftt = block[0];
00349         right = block[1];
00350         work = ((leftt >> 4) ^ right) & 0x0f0f0f0fL;
00351         right ^= work;
00352         leftt ^= (work << 4);
00353         work = ((leftt >> 16) ^ right) & 0x0000ffffL;
00354         right ^= work;
00355         leftt ^= (work << 16);
00356         work = ((right >> 2) ^ leftt) & 0x33333333L;
00357         leftt ^= work;
00358         right ^= (work << 2);
00359         work = ((right >> 8) ^ leftt) & 0x00ff00ffL;
00360         leftt ^= work;
00361         right ^= (work << 8);
00362         right = ((right << 1) | ((right >> 31) & 1L)) & 0xffffffffL;
00363         work = (leftt ^ right) & 0xaaaaaaaaL;
00364         leftt ^= work;
00365         right ^= work;
00366         leftt = ((leftt << 1) | ((leftt >> 31) & 1L)) & 0xffffffffL;
00367 
00368         for( round = 0; round < 8; round++ ) {
00369                 work  = (right << 28) | (right >> 4);
00370                 work ^= *keys++;
00371                 fval  = SP7[ work                & 0x3fL];
00372                 fval |= SP5[(work >>  8) & 0x3fL];
00373                 fval |= SP3[(work >> 16) & 0x3fL];
00374                 fval |= SP1[(work >> 24) & 0x3fL];
00375                 work  = right ^ *keys++;
00376                 fval |= SP8[ work                & 0x3fL];
00377                 fval |= SP6[(work >>  8) & 0x3fL];
00378                 fval |= SP4[(work >> 16) & 0x3fL];
00379                 fval |= SP2[(work >> 24) & 0x3fL];
00380                 leftt ^= fval;
00381                 work  = (leftt << 28) | (leftt >> 4);
00382                 work ^= *keys++;
00383                 fval  = SP7[ work                & 0x3fL];
00384                 fval |= SP5[(work >>  8) & 0x3fL];
00385                 fval |= SP3[(work >> 16) & 0x3fL];
00386                 fval |= SP1[(work >> 24) & 0x3fL];
00387                 work  = leftt ^ *keys++;
00388                 fval |= SP8[ work                & 0x3fL];
00389                 fval |= SP6[(work >>  8) & 0x3fL];
00390                 fval |= SP4[(work >> 16) & 0x3fL];
00391                 fval |= SP2[(work >> 24) & 0x3fL];
00392                 right ^= fval;
00393         }
00394 
00395         right = (right << 31) | (right >> 1);
00396         work = (leftt ^ right) & 0xaaaaaaaaL;
00397         leftt ^= work;
00398         right ^= work;
00399         leftt = (leftt << 31) | (leftt >> 1);
00400         work = ((leftt >> 8) ^ right) & 0x00ff00ffL;
00401         right ^= work;
00402         leftt ^= (work << 8);
00403         work = ((leftt >> 2) ^ right) & 0x33333333L;
00404         right ^= work;
00405         leftt ^= (work << 2);
00406         work = ((right >> 16) ^ leftt) & 0x0000ffffL;
00407         leftt ^= work;
00408         right ^= (work << 16);
00409         work = ((right >> 4) ^ leftt) & 0x0f0f0f0fL;
00410         leftt ^= work;
00411         right ^= (work << 4);
00412         *block++ = right;
00413         *block = leftt;
00414         return;
00415 }
